item.title: :drum: DRUM SOLO COMPETITION :drum:- Winners: Kerfuffle and Lowey!
item.dc:creator: enby
item.description:
This was fun to watch. I feel like I struggle in making good drum tracks so this was helpful for me. I kinda wanna take a year to learn drums in order to get some hands on insight into creating realistic beats. Sometime in the distant future perhaps?

item.title: :drum: DRUM SOLO COMPETITION :drum:- Winners: Kerfuffle and Lowey!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
lowey:

7 minutes of drum loop is certainly … avant garde

Just needed something I could rap over.
 

it’s an interesting idea to collaborate with a younger version of yourself.

Nah, that kid was even more of a d**k than I am.
(I recently digitised hours of synth ideas from my late teens, that I’ll maybe be plucking some stuff from and developing.)

But, hey, if you think there’s anything good you could get out of that stuff, feel free.
(I’ve set it for downloads.)

For me, the best bit is the tape clicks and noise before the drums actually start.
(I’ve got an underused Strymon El Capistan dTape delay if I wanted to add some age and wonkiness to stuff now.)

 
Apologies to @MisterMaster. Didn’t mean to derail the thread.

Read full topic
item.source: :drum: DRUM SOLO COMPETITION :drum:- Winners: Kerfuffle and Lowey!

item.title: :drum: DRUM SOLO COMPETITION :drum:- Winners: Kerfuffle and Lowey!
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
7 minutes of drum loop is certainly … avant garde

You should clean the sample up a little and build a track on top of it. Would give a nice low-fi sound, and it’s an interesting idea to collaborate with a younger version of yourself.

Hm, Auxy time capsules. Now there’s an interesting thought

Read full topic

item.source: :drum: DRUM SOLO COMPETITION :drum:- Winners: Kerfuffle and Lowey!

item.title: :drum: DRUM SOLO COMPETITION :drum:- Winners: Kerfuffle and Lowey!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
[Edit: Link corrected]

A bit of on-topic comic relief during the interval?

(A dodgy, old cassette recording of) The first ever piece of music I created and recorded (back in the mists of time.) was a drum track on a Yamaha RY30. The first time I’d ever touched a proper piece of electronic music hardware.

https://soundcloud.com/akasnd/first-drumbeat-yamaha-ry30/s-62Asp

(Things were different then. I don’t expect anyone to endure the full 7 minutes :cringe:

Compare what I was producing as a 14 years to what some of y’all nippers are doing here now. Chalk and cheese – my stuff being the cheeeese.

Read full topic
